lines.text: Do you smoke?
No, it makes me dizzy.
Me too, that's why I like it.
Well I try to do natural things. A lot of people in my family died of cancer. Bye.
They... they died of cancer smoking pot?
[last lines]
You know weddings are the happiest events I could possibly dream of and yet some how when they're over it's always so sad.
Yea, I know what you mean.
You must have had a beautiful wedding. Did you?

Oh yea, I had a great weddin'. Umm, it wasn't anything like this. We were real poor but it was beautiful and my husband Russell looked so handsome. You know all the girls were after him, but he picked me to marry. Yea I think that was the happiest day of my life. But you're right, when it's over it gets real sad.
Oh you shouldn't put tap water on your face, hun, cause it will dry your skin out and give you wrinkles.
Oh, that's ok. I plan to age interestingly.
You are cute. I wish you were my sister-in-law.
I'm pregnant
[opening lines]

[referring to Regina]
Pret-ty woman.
Boy look what a beautiful glaze she's got on her eyes.
I'd call that glassy eyed.
Hmmm.
What the hell is that?
That's a glass of milk.
You're kidding?
Dr. Meecham as a physician you should know the body is the temple of the Holy Spirit.
You mean you don't drink?
No.
In other words, when you get up in the morning that's as good as you're gonna feel all day.
Again. You know I've been married four times, and never thought I was gonna do it again. At least I didn't think so.
Well I've never been married.
Never?
Never. Not unless you can call being married to a lawn mower a marriage.
There's uh, there's nothing wrong with you is there?
No. There's nothing wrong with me.
Well have you ever given some real thought maybe to a, a trip to New Jersey, huh?
You have some hedges that need trimming my dear?
I got a whole lawn that needs trimming.
That sounds good.

[offering a glass to Lemay]
Want some champagne?
Excuse me.
[exits restroom]
Thank you.
[intercepts Lemay's champagne glass]
Lemay, the fly.
[exits restroom]
He's awfully interested in your fly isn't he?
Yea. In fact he's interested in everybody's fly.
Uh, oh, I remember THE FLY. That was a great picture, uh, David Hedison.
I'll see you down there.
Catch you later man.
An excelent science fic... sci-fi film.

[to his family]
What's everybody standing around for? There's not a God-damned thing we can do about it! It's a hell of a wedding!

[looking at the guests]
Jesus, it's like the last ten days of Hitler!

[High on the pills given to her by Dr. Meachum]
Death is a horseman. Death is a thief in the night. Death is a four letter word.
